Superman.Action: Carries the unconscious cosmonaut gently back to the capsule, speaks to him in perfect Russian, ensuring his safety.
Smiles humbly after the cosmonauts clasp hands in thanks.
Carries the spaceship gently through space and rescues the unconscious cosmonaut, maneuvers him skillfully into the airlock and repairs the damaged door.
Responds calmly and confidently in the heat of crisis, speaks fluent Russian to reassure the cosmonaut.
Flies off immediately to ensure the safety of the cosmonaut instead of hesitating or ignoring the situation.
Shares a silent moment honoring his adoptive parents' graves, showing reverence and gratitude.
Hides Kal-El's rocket carefully and listens emotionally to his father's message.
Remembers and honors his past by visiting his adoptive parents' graves, showing emotional grounding and reflection.
Excavates and carefully hides his Kryptonian rocket, showing foresight and responsibility to protect his origins.
Responds to the message from Jor-El with emotional overwhelm, showing vulnerability rather than confident control.
Politely refuses to sell the farm to a big developer, expressing a desire to keep it a working farm.
Distracts Hornsby with a handshake and smiles when greeting him.
Carefully retrieves the power module and cradles it with reverence, showing thoughtful handling of a powerful artifact.
Stashes the module quickly and discreetly under a tarp to protect it, indicating situational awareness and prudence.
Engages politely and confidently with Hornsby, deflecting sales pressure with clear, principled reasoning.
Offers old baseball mitt, ball, and bat to Mr. Hornsby for his grandchildren.
Chuckles politely at Mr. Hornsby's joke about his father.
Holds the car door open for Mr. Hornsby.
Changes the subject to avoid lingering on a cracked baby crib (possibly avoiding more emotional engagement).
Misses the baseball swing but plays along in a friendly manner.
Polite and resolute in conversation, showing social awareness and self-control when changing the subject away from a sensitive topic.
Attempts to bat a ball but completely misses, showing lack of skill or physical coordination in this mundane task.
Holds the car door open for Hornsby, walks him back to his car.
Responds politely to Hornsby's caution about being far from home, shows respect.
Smiles and plays baseball alone, showing a light-hearted and innocent side.
Records an answering machine message, sounding uncomfortable and somewhat awkward.
Talks to the answering machine as if to Lois, shows a friendly and hopeful attitude despite loneliness.
Rushed and distracted at breakfast, not fully attentive to surroundings.
Holds the car door open politely for Hornsby and walks him back to his car with a friendly demeanor.
Throws the ball effortlessly very far, showing physical skill and confidence.
Records an uncomfortable, hesitant answering machine message, indicating possible social awkwardness or lack of ease.
Immediately tries to respond to Lois's call and mentally keeps up with the situation of Perry wanting a meeting.
Fails to notice the milk has turned sour until pouring it, showing a minor inattentiveness.
Observes the elderly engineer about to collapse and realizes a disaster is imminent but keeps calm and takes quick action to save the train and its passengers.
Uses X-ray vision to detect a medical emergency on the train and quickly changes into Superman to intervene.
Attempts to overtake a speeding train to prevent disaster, demonstrating urgency and situational awareness.
Stops an out-of-control subway train to save the passengers and gently helps ease the train to a stop, then takes responsibility to get the unconscious engineer to a hospital.
Acknowledges Lois with a half-smile before resuming his rescue.

Recognizes a danger on a speeding subway and intercepts it by standing calmly in its path, then uses his knowledge to short the electric current by kicking the third rail, effectively stopping the train safely and rescuing an unconscious engineer.
Slides behind Lois to observe the meeting and gather information about the situation at the Daily Planet.
Shows curiosity and engagement by asking what's going on and seeking to understand the context.
Politely steps forward to greet Lacy Warfield with a smile.
Questions sensationalist headline as irresponsible, showing concern for truth.
Attempts to calm Perry to avoid rash actions.
Politely steps forward to greet Lacy Warfield, maintaining composure despite her cold reception.
Questions irresponsibly sensational headlines, demonstrating critical thinking and concern for truth.
Warns Mr. White not to act rashly, showing confidence and a calming presence during conflict.
Stands up for journalistic integrity and truth, politely confronts Miss Warfield about fairness to staff and readers.
Clark stands up to Miss Warfield and asserts the importance of truth and the responsibility of reporters in a confident and skillful manner.
Clark acts impulsively by confronting Warfield before Lois can stop him, potentially risking unintended consequences.
His chiseled features stare off into the distance as if he just heard a cry for help.
His chiseled features stare off into the distance as if he just heard a cry for help.
Donates a single strand of his hair to the museum to demonstrate his strength.
Graciously donates a strand of his hair to the museum for public display.
Graciously donates a strand of hair to the museum, demonstrating confidence in his strength and legacy.
Absent from the scene where his personal genetic material is stolen, showing a lack of vigilance or protective action.
Casually offers to take care of a letter addressed to Superman, showing a willingness to help.
Appears uncomfortable with Lacy's attempts to set him up socially, indicating a modest and sincere disposition.
Casually handles a potentially serious letter addressed to Superman without showing concern, indicating relaxed confidence and control.
Appears uncomfortable and somewhat evasive about participating in a new writing assignment, showing hesitation rather than confident acceptance.
Smiles at Jeremy, appearing to offer encouragement during a moment of doubt.
Is shaken to the core after reading Jeremy's letter, showing emotional sensitivity.
Quietly slips away when Lacy seizes the letter for publicity purposes, avoiding complicity in exploiting Jeremy.
Reads letter quietly then out loud with clear understanding of the stakes involved.
Quietly slips away after observing media escalation rather than confronting it immediately.
Appears to Jeremy outside the classroom window, creating a morale boost and personal connection.
Visits Jeremy's classroom personally to answer his letter, showing respect and acknowledgment.
Explains his vow not to interfere in Earth's destiny respectfully and sincerely, showing honesty and transparency.
Promises to pass Jeremy's letter to world leaders, demonstrating consideration and commitment.
Says 'I'm sorry' to Jeremy after disappointing him, acknowledging Jeremy’s feelings with empathy.
Does not provide Jeremy with a direct solution or comfort beyond the vow and passing on the letter, potentially showing limitation in warmth.
Visits Jeremy in person to respond to his letter, demonstrating attentiveness and respect for individuals.
Explains clearly and honestly the limits of his power and vows not to interfere with Earth's destiny.
Promises to pass Jeremy's letter to world leaders, acknowledging proper channels of influence and leadership.
Unable to comfort or convince Jeremy when he expresses disappointment, possibly showing limited emotional connection or persuasive skill.
Has all of Superman's powers; implied to be powerful and strong.

Not directly shown in this excerpt; no action or statement by Superman indicating competence.
Politely apologizes for being late to Lacy and insists on getting in line.
When jostled on the crowded dance floor, he consistently says 'Excuse me' each time.
Disappears quickly from the scene, showing ability to move stealthily.
Paces with Lacy, apologizes and quickly decides to get in line, showing social adaptability though no special skill.
Insists he is with Lacy to gain entry past the bouncers, showing quick thinking and confidence.
Is repeatedly bumped and jostled on the dance floor but politely says 'Excuse me' each time, indicating patience but possibly lack of assertiveness or command in a crowded social environment.
Consistently says 'Excuse me' when bumped and jostled in a crowded place.
Notices a young couple forlornly waiting at the end of the line and uses his speed to bring them inside so they can dance.
Leans over the young couple and gently encourages them to dance, behaving as if just passing by.
Cuts back in to dance with Lacy, taking her hand and dancing old-fashioned style.
Quickly locates the young couple at the end of the long line and transports them inside the club in an instant, enabling them to dance as they wished.
Acts calm and purposeful while handling crowded and potentially difficult social situations, like navigating through bouncers and crowds.
Backs away sheepishly when cut in by a Don Johnson surrogate on the dance floor, showing social awkwardness or lack of assertiveness.
Reflects nostalgically on Smallville where people would sacrifice everything to help others.
Gently reassures Lacy when she feels light-headed, saying 'Don't worry, I've got you.'
Admits having no romantic attachments back home and explains career takes much of his time without evident bitterness or dismissal.
Uses superhearing to detect a distant scream, disengages from social situation quickly to respond to danger.
Caught unawares twice by Nuclear Man's physical attacks during pursuit.
Effortlessly catches a lamppost swung at him, swings it violently around and then lets go, sending Nuclear Man flying.
Caught unawares by Nuclear Man's punch to the mouth.
Headline reads 'SUPERMAN TO KID: DROP DEAD,' causing heartbreak to Clark Kent and others.
Clark offers a smile to Jeremy, a bewildered kid being escorted away by cronies.
Although facing public backlash (headline 'SUPERMAN TO KID: DROP DEAD'), Superman remains a central figure with others believing he knows what he is doing.
Clark (Superman) is shown as serious and thoughtful, indicating internal processing of situation rather than rash behavior.
Clark comforts and reassures Jeremy, showing understanding of the boy's feelings and encouraging trust in Superman's goodness.
Reflects on the fate of Krypton and the potential fate of Earth with concern, showing he cares about others' wellbeing.
Acknowledges he has been forbidden to act but still worries about humanity, indicating a sincere, protective nature.
Expresses understanding that teaching the world to rely on one man can teach betrayal, showing a tolerant and wise perspective.
Reflects deeply on the fate of Krypton and Earth, showing awareness and thoughtful consideration of consequences before acting.
Feels torn and uncertain, falls to his knees under emotional and sonic pressure but ultimately resolves to act despite warnings, showing resilience and resolve.
Acknowledges the warnings of the Elders about interference and the dangers of putting faith in one individual, showing intelligence and humility.
Chooses to draw on the example of learning from children rather than just wise men, indicating adaptive thinking and openness.
Descending between the buildings, flying low over traffic, hovering just above the traffic and searching for something or someone.
Appears distracted or unfocused as he is looking for 'something or someone' but without clear indication of a plan or focus in this excerpt.
Puts his arm around Jeremy as Jimmy snaps a picture.
Invites Jeremy to take a walk with him.
Leads a crowd peacefully towards the U.N., allowing Jeremy to stay in the visitor's gallery to avoid overwhelm.
Confidently leads a crowd through a busy street and gains admiring attention without breaking pace or showing hesitation.
Engages with entry guards at the U.N. with composed assertiveness, prompting them to allow him entry despite lacking a pass.
Takes charge of the situation by leading civilians and managing public attention skillfully.
Walks slowly and humbly into the U.N. Assembly, seeking permission respectfully to address delegates of all countries.
Acknowledges the beauty and diversity of many cultures and the joy of their accomplishments before addressing their faults.
Calmly requests permission to speak to the U.N. General Assembly despite protocol, and successfully gains universal delegate support.
Walks slowly and humbly into the assembly, projecting confidence without arrogance.
Engages the diverse global audience effectively, demonstrating awareness and respect for different cultures.
Declares that Earth is his home and commits to rid the planet of all nuclear weapons to protect humanity from destruction.
Publicly declares his commitment to rid the planet of all nuclear weapons, taking a proactive leadership role addressing global threat.
Assumes responsibility that governments have failed to handle, demonstrating confidence and determination.
Catches and safely redirects missiles to prevent nuclear disaster, demonstrating protection of all sides.
Takes on the immense task of disposing of global arsenals alone without complaint.
Guides Soviet missile out of atmosphere to remove nuclear threat.
Places missile into a steel net in space with other missiles, helping to neutralize them.
Destroys the net with all nuclear missiles by sending it into the sun, promoting peace.
Pauses momentarily after destruction of missiles before heading home, showing reflective or serious demeanor.
Rides the Soviet missile out of the atmosphere and carefully guides it into a giant steel net in space prepared to contain the nuclear payloads.
With great effort, whirls the huge net with missiles around and hurls it into the sun, effectively destroying it to neutralize the nuclear threat.
Hovers for a moment after destroying the net of nuclear weapons, then turns for home without hesitation.
Interrupts the missile launch and skillfully guides the deadly load towards the sun, throwing it with a mighty heave.
Tries to participate despite struggling and risking embarrassment.
Shows vulnerability by admitting he is not strong enough yet.
Responds honestly and kindly to Lacy's concern about avoidance.

Catches a tourist who slipped and returns her safely to her husband.
Flies into the eye of the tornado and counters its rotation by flying faster in the opposite direction, successfully dissipating it.
Rescues a two-year-old child from a damaged house and returns her safely to her parents.
Immediately pursues the Nuclear Man after securing the safety of the family, showing prioritization and decisiveness.
Engages in a fierce combat with Nuclear Man in space and lands a decisive blow, forcing his opponent to fall.
Knocks aside hundreds of stones and bricks hurled at him at super-speed by Nuclear Man, demonstrating quick reflexes and skill.
Catches a tourist falling off the Great Wall and returns her safely to her husband.
Catches a falling tourist and safely returns her to her husband.
Reassembles a wall quickly and without complaint.
Intervenes to protect a peaceful town from lava by creatively stopping the flow and freezing it.
Quickly reassembles the wall by restoring every brick and stone into place.

Blows his super-breath to freeze a lava flow and protect a town from destruction.
Recoils and allows Nuclear Man to escape during their initial space struggle.
Forces a warhead away from the Russian leaders at moment of impact, preventing harm to dignitaries.
Continues relentless pursuit of opponent despite being weakened, fatigued, and hurt, demonstrating commitment to protecting others.

Smashes free from being encased in ice, showing physical resilience and determination.
Arrives just in time to divert a missile threatening political leaders, preventing disaster.

Flies the Statue of Liberty back to its rightful place despite being burdened and vulnerable.

Flies the Statue back to its rightful place above the city despite the burden.

Replaces the Statue of Liberty before collapsing in agony at its base.
Is swiftly kicked by Nuclear Man and sent flying out of sight and into space, effectively removed from the confrontation.

Implied to have destroyed nuclear missiles to promote world peace, demonstrating proactive, decisive action against a global threat.
Faced with skepticism and accusations from Lex Luthor questioning his effectiveness and honesty, indicating limits in his ability to control public perception and political narratives.
Unable to move, dizzy, shaken, collapses on the floor after touching his pierced hand.

Attempts to downplay his illness and resists sharing his burden with Lois.
Sits helplessly on the couch, pale and clearly unwell, unable to explain his situation or call for help.
Attempts to deflect concern by faintly smiling and reassuring Lois that he will manage wherever he is, showing some controlled composure.
Lifts his trembling hand gently to Lois's cheek, showing vulnerability and connection.
Asks Lois sincerely to let him rest alone, showing need for personal space without harshness.
Accepts and values the package from Lois thoughtfully, showing appreciation and trust.
Shows emotional vulnerability and requests to be left alone to rest, demonstrating self-awareness of his limits.
Carefully and deliberately opens the package containing his cape, showing deliberate and skillful handling.
Observes himself aging and changing physically with disbelief, indicating some awareness but possible uncertainty about the situation.
Uses the last of his strength to activate a healing module despite his own weakening condition.
Reflects silently on the city below as he fades into unconsciousness, suggesting a thoughtful, sincere moment.
Despite physical deterioration and aging effects, Superman perseveres with determination to activate the module using his last bit of strength.
Clings to the ledge and uses remaining energy to accomplish the task, showing resourcefulness and willpower in a dire situation.

Warns Nuclear Man not to enter elevator, showing concern for the safety of a third party.

Delivers Nuclear Man into a remote, isolated location (the dark side of the moon) instead of inflicting punishment or destruction on Earth.
